    • Method Detail

      • construct

        public Test construct(QAConfig sysConfig)
               throws Exception
        Description copied from class: QATestEnvironment
        This method is called by the MasterTest immediately before the run method is called. Override this method to implement test specific construct code. This method:
        • saves a reference to config
        • starts the class server identified by the serviceName "qaClassServer" if the config value named org.apache.river.qa.harness.runkitserver is true (the default)
        • starts the class server identified by the serviceName "jiniClassServer" if the config value named org.apache.river.qa.harness.runjiniserver is true (the default)

        In the majority of cases this method will be overridden. The first action taken by the method should be a call to super.construct(sysConfig).

        Specified by:
        construct in interface TestEnvironment
        Overrides:
        construct in class QATestEnvironment
        Parameters:
        sysConfig - the test properties
        Returns:
        Test to run.
        Throws:
        Exception - if any failure occurs during construct

      • tearDown

        public void tearDown()
        Description copied from class: QATestEnvironment
        This method is called by the MasterTest immediately after the run method returns. Override this method to implement test specific cleanup code. This method cancels all tracked leases, destroys all services that were started by the AdminManager, and sends a TeardownRequest to all participating SlaveTests.

        If this method is overridden, the overriding method should include a call to super.teardown(). In most cases, this will be done as the final action of the overriding method, since test specific cleanup may depend on access to services destroyed by this method.

        Specified by:
        tearDown in interface TestEnvironment
        Overrides:
        tearDown in class QATestEnvironment

      • checkUnmarshallingException

        protected void checkUnmarshallingException(Throwable thrown,
                                           ByteArrayInputStream response)
                                    throws TestException
        Verify that an exception thrown while unmarshalling was properly wrapped and re-thrown. This method returns normally if the correct exception was thrown to this instance; otherwise a TestException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        thrown - the exception thrown while unmarshalling
        response - the response stream containing the returned exception
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if response is null
        TestException - if the returned exception is the wrong type
